text: Part of the reason I love this game's soundtrack so much is the whole '90s vibe it has. The instrumentation mixed with the reverb is perfect. I can understand why composers rarely use reverb, but when used right it enhances the atmosphere/immersion and makes it feel like the music is being played inside the game's environment. Thumbs up to this game for winning the PS1 tournament in the Community section.
author: SupraDarky

text: Ah, another great "wait, this wasn't already uploaded already?" addition! Congrats to SotN for a well deserved victory!
author: Speedwagon is Best Girl

text:
Reminds me a lot of Sonic CD’s soundtrack. That one also sounds very 90s-esque, and it’s my personal favorite album from the Sonic games.

In other words, I need to try this game someday. Too bad it’s not on Steam.

text: I really love Castlevania music, and was very glad to see Symphony win the Community Contest. The one thing that always weirds me out is that despite the high quality of the whole soundtrack for this game, whenever I want to listen to Castlevania music I always go for more classic entries, like Aquarius or Wicked Child.

text: Just recently bought and beat Bloodstained. Working on 100% it right now, I had a lot of fun despite the game's enormous amount of jank. I might try and find something to play SotN on after I'm done with that.
author: TimBagels

text: The most magnificent of all OSTs
author: w

text: I REALLY hope Konami releases some kind of Castlevania collection on PS4 with Aria of Sorrow & Dawn of Sorrow, that would be super dope. I imagine that they will at some point since they did SotN and Rondo of Blood, and I know they have another collection containing the originals, but Aria and Dawn of Sorrow are 2 of my 3 favorite Castlevania games, and it would only make sense to release them together. Or maybe a collection of the 3 DS games, Dawn of Sorrow, Portrait of Ruin and Order of Ecclesia. I guess that would make sense too.
